summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. District Court for the District of Virgin Islands to the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein, requiring the production of all records turned over to WilmerHale in the case of Government of the United States Virgin Islands v. JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A. The subpoena commands appearance or document production by August 15, 2023, and includes a certificate of authenticity form for business records.

connections.description: Daniel Ruzumna is listed as the attorney representing the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a posthumous attorney-client relationship.
As U.S. Attorney, Delia L. Smith's office is issuing the grand jury subpoena to the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein, establishing an adversarial legal relationship.

locations: Ron de Lugo Federal Building & Courthouse, 5500 Veteran's Drive, 3rd Floor, St. Thomas, VI 00802
5500 Veterans Drive, Suite 260, St. Thomas, VI 00802
keyFacts: A federal grand jury in the Virgin Islands is actively investigating matters related to Jeffrey Epstein as of August 2023, years after his death.

The subpoena seeks all records, information, and materials turned over to the law firm WilmerHale in the separate civil case 'Government of the United States Virgin Islands v. JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A.'.
Compliance can be achieved by providing the requested documents to the Assistant U.S. Attorney prior to the court date, eliminating the need for a physical appearance.
The document includes a formal 'Certificate of Authenticity' form to be completed under penalty of perjury, indicating the records are sought as business evidence.
